channel.title: Crash when turn on fan
channel.description: When I turn on the giant fan in chapter1act4c (with the gargantua thing) the fan slowly turns on... then when it reaches full speed the game crashes every time, no matter how close or far away I am. Any potential reason why?

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: EvilCreepr
item.description:
johny:

OK I destroyed all crates in ventilator area and it works.

Works!!! thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: Phirebird
item.description:
pdgeorge:

YAY! I got past that bit.
I re-checked the room with the dead security guard in it (I had killed him earlier but re-checked anyway)
Also when it was crashing, I had thrown some wood onto the turbine. This time I didn’t and it didn’t crash. Not sure which fixed it, hope it helps others

To all people with this issue:

It may be ATI related, and could have to do with the way how ATI drivers handle memory or physics.

My FIX:

Completely pummel the boxes and crates within wind tunnel using the crowbar (small pieces can be broken down further) and then go up and down the ladders to make sure the pieces fade away. I chose to run up both ladders without looking back, saved it and then looked back and it worked.

Read full topic

item.description:

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AtwKVHh7_EI

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: L0L182
item.description:
Alright i had same issue as most off you guys here.
What i did after reading all this, i destroyed anything wood wise within the vicinity off the fan as well as the “control room” where you killed the 2 zombies.
And yes i killed all 3 zombies, but it seems that its a prop issue in that area so destroying it seems to fix the problem. preferable destroy it before turning fan on.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: fdisk
item.description:
I created a topic about this not noticing there was already one posted. I am reposting the info I posted there in case it helps the devs/community:

Status command:
hostname: Half-Life 2
version : 1.0.1.0/14 4104 insecure
map : bm_c1a4c at: -3877 x, -611 y, -991 z
players : 1 (1 max)

userid name uniqueid connected ping loss state adr

4 “fdisk” UNKNOWN 00:20 34 0 active loopback

Here are my computer specs:
ASUS M4A785-M Motherboard
AMD Phenom 9750 Quad Core Processor 2.40 GHz
Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit
6.00 GB RAM (5.75 GB Usable), 3x2GB DDR3
ATI Radeon HD 4200 (Integrated)
ST31000520AS 1.0TB HDD
I can provide more details if needed.

I was able to continue my game by doing this again except without killing the zombie in the little room with the shotgun ammo (I just grabbed the ammo and avoided the zombie). I will also include a copy of one of the dump files created by Source SDK 2007.

It seems to me after reading this thread that it has very little or nothing to do with computer hardware as I saw someone else here had an Intel setup with Windows XP and I have an AMD setup with Windows 7.
hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_16T2_33_5C0.mdmp (95 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: Findulidas
item.description:
I have the same issue as you guys, crashed on the fan twice now and its the first crash Ive gotten so far.

This is a bummer, if I cant get past it ill use noclip to get past it because that works. Something I recommend for people having trouble in games that bug out/crash in general and arent experienced enough with the engine to fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: fdisk
item.description:
I created a new topic for it I didn’t realize you had already posted one I may delete my thread then. I was able to work around it by opening the door to the room with the shotgun ammo and collecting the ammo WITHOUT killing the zombie. Based on other replies YMMV.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: sanatsuo
item.description:
i havent been able to find a way to fix this but i did find if you turn the fan out and dash up to the top of the ladder where you were at when you entered the room the game wont crash and you can continue from there

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: ASSCRASH
item.description:
I don’t know if this has anything to do with it, but I went through the door at the bottom of the room with the three tentacles and restored the power before turning on the fan and I didn’t crash. I’m not sure if you necessarily have to do it in this order, but it seemed to have fixed the problem for me.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: eryx2071
item.description:
Same here. Killing or not zombies doesn’t help. Will try with loading save with console. BUT HOW ?

—edit--------

ok In my case destroying all the crates helped.

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: SPBHM
item.description:
nanashikun:

Hi,
I’ve killed the zombie in the room and it didn’t stop the game from crashing after turning the fan on :[
Hopefully there’ll be a bugfix soon

interesting,
I tried 4 or 5 times,
both times I didn’t enter the room the game crashed when the fan starts to go faster, and all the times I entered the room and killed the zombie before (and took the shotgun ammo) it didn’t…

I always turned the fan on and quickly ran upstairs.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: BeatAngel
item.description:
Hi! A have same problem. First I went into the room and killed the security guard zombies. After turning on the fan game crashes. =)

I found the solution - after the button is pressed the fan - right QUICKLY RUN up the stairs (see so did not touch the fan blades) and climb up - the problem is solved!

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: StAsMaN
item.description:
Guys… It also crused for me if I killed the zombie, now i just didn’t enter that room where the zomibe is, a just went to turn on the fun, and it worked for me! Try to not enter and not to kill that zombie, just turn on the fun at once.

Read full topic

item.title: Crash when turn on fan

item.description:
Same issue here.
Edit: Temp solution is to reload the map with the console (do not use load save game in this case).

item.title: Crash when turn on fan
item.dc:creator: SPBHM
item.description:
I think I discovered the cause of the crash,
IF you go down, and try to turn on the fan before killing the zombie on the small room, the game will crash, if you kill it first, the game will not crash.

(or maybe it’s just entering the room that solves the crash),
regardless, enter that room, kill the zombie and the game will not crash when you turn on the fan.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: SPBHM
item.description:
same crash for me

edit:

I’m using catalyst 12.3
windows XP
my PC seems stable,
soundcard is a xonar with latest drivers.
CPU core i3 (no overclock)

I did a clean steam install yesterday (deleted and downloaded everything again), the only games I have are TF2, SDK base 2007 and black mesa.
